blocks.name: dscmet
blocks.content: The discrete metric on any set ` X ` . Definition 1.1-8 of [Kreyszig] p. 8. (Contributed by FL, 12-Oct-2006.)

thm dscmet(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c2 ∈(Met ` c0))
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ c0 ↦ if(s0 = s1, 0, 1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpbiri(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈(Met ` c0), ((c2 :(c0 × c0)→ ℝ)∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0,(((hs0[c2]hs1)= 0 ↔ hs0 = hs1)∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ c0,(hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1))))))))
  pm3.2i((c2 :(c0 × c0)→ ℝ), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0,(((hs0[c2]hs1)= 0 ↔ hs0 = hs1)∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ c0,(hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1)))))))
  mpbi((c2 :(c0 × c0)→ ℝ), ∀(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, if(s0 = s1, 0, 1)∈ ℝ)))
  rgen2w(s0, s1, c0, c0, if(s0 = s1, 0, 1)∈ ℝ)
  ifcli(nat0, nat1, cr, s0 = s1)
  fmpt2(s0, s1, c0, c0, if(s0 = s1, 0, 1), cr, c2)
  rgen2a(hs0, hs1, c0, (((hs0[c2]hs1)= 0 ↔ hs0 = hs1)∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ c0,(hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1)))))
  jca((hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0), ((hs0[c2]hs1)= 0 ↔ hs0 = hs1), ∀(hs2 ∈ c0,(hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1))))
  syl6bb((hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0), (hs0[c2]hs1)= 0, hs0 = hs1, if(hs0 = hs1, 0, 1)= 0)
  eqeq1d((hs0[c2]hs1), nat0, if(hs0 = hs1, 0, 1), (hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0))
  ralrimiv(hs2, c0, (hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0), (hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1)))
  expcom((hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0), hs2 ∈ c0, (hs0[c2]hs1)[≤]((hs2[c2]hs0)[+](hs2[c2]hs1)))

blocks.content: The discrete metric generates the discrete topology. In particular, the discrete topology is metrizable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Jan-2014.)

blocks.name: abvmet
blocks.content: An absolute value ` F ` generates a metric defined by ` d ( x , y ) = F ( x - y ) ` , analogously to ~ cnmet . (In fact, the ring structure is not needed at all; the group properties ~ abveq0 and ~ abvtri , ~ abvneg are sufficient.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm abvmet(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ccom(c0, c2), cfv(cmet, c3)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cabv, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(csg, c4))
} = {
  nrmmetd(hs0, hs1, c0, c2, c3, c4, cfv(c0g, c4), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c4, cgrp), wcel(c4, crg))
  abvrcl(c0, c1, c4)
  ringgrp(c4)
  abvf(c0, c1, c3, c4)
  abveq0(c0, c1, cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c0g, c4), c4)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c4))
  3expb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs1), c3), wbr(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1))), cle, co(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  abvsubtri(c0, c1, cv(hs0), c3, cv(hs1), c2, c4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c4))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(c0g, c4))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, c1))
}
